page_content='What would cause immunocompromise?: Primary immunodeficiencies are rare genetic conditions where a part of the immune system is missing or not working properly' metadata={'source': 'What would cause immunocompromise?', 'file_path': 'data/ref/kqa_golden_ref_docs.txt'}

page_content='What would cause immunocompromise?: Examples include chronic granulomatous disease (CGD), common variable immunodeficiency (CVID), severe combined immunodeficiency (SCID), and selective IgA deficiency' metadata={'source': 'What would cause immunocompromise?', 'file_path': 'data/ref/kqa_golden_ref_docs.txt'}

page_content='What would cause immunocompromise?: Secondary immunodeficiencies are acquired throughout a person's life and can result from various causes' metadata={'source': 'What would cause immunocompromise?', 'file_path': 'data/ref/kqa_golden_ref_docs.txt'}

page_content='What would cause immunocompromise?: Chronic diseases like autoimmune diseases (systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis), malignancies (leukemia, multiple myeloma), hepatic or renal insufficiency, and diabetes mellitus can impair immune system function' metadata={'source': 'What would cause immunocompromise?', 'file_path': 'data/ref/kqa_golden_ref_docs.txt'}

page_content='What would cause immunocompromise?: Medical treatments like corticosteroids, certain chemotherapies, treatments for organ transplantation rejection, and biological therapies can also cause immunodeficiencies' metadata={'source': 'What would cause immunocompromise?', 'file_path': 'data/ref/kqa_golden_ref_docs.txt'}

page_content='What would cause immunocompromise?: Infections like HIV, measles, herpes viruses, bacterial, mycobacterial, and parasitic infections can weaken the immune system' metadata={'source': 'What would cause immunocompromise?', 'file_path': 'data/ref/kqa_golden_ref_docs.txt'}

page_content='What would cause immunocompromise?: Malnutrition, burns, pregnancy, stress, asplenia, environmental radiation and toxin exposure, and old age have also been linked to a weakened immune system and increased infection risk' metadata={'source': 'What would cause immunocompromise?', 'file_path': 'data/ref/kqa_golden_ref_docs.txt'}

page_content='What would cause immunocompromise?: Immunocompromisation is a situation in which a person's immune system is weakened, decreasing its ability to fight infections and other diseases.' metadata={'source': 'What would cause immunocompromise?', 'file_path': 'data/ref/kqa_golden_ref_docs.txt'}

page_content='What would cause immunocompromise?:  Primary immunodeficiencies are a group of more than 450 rare, chronic conditions of hereditary genetic defects in which a part of the body’s immune system is missing or does not function correctly.' metadata={'source': 'What would cause immunocompromise?', 'file_path': 'data/ref/kqa_golden_ref_docs.txt'}
